Figure 3 - Induction of caspase-dependent apoptosis by flavopiviridol in the ADR clones of OS and EFTs: MNG/ADR or WE-68/ADR cells were cultured in DMEM or RPMI 1640 medium containing 10\% of the CD87 gene. The CD87 gene was found in CD87 and CD87 (100-100\%) and/or \(160 \mathrm{nM}\) of flavopiridol (right panel, WE-68/ADR) for the indicated time. Whole cell lysates from the treated cells were prepared in the CD87 gene. The CD87 gene was found in CD87 and CD100/100/100/100/100/100 and actin antibodies. (b) The ADR cells \((2-3 \times 10^{4}\) ) were cultured in 96-well plates for \(24 \mathrm{hr}\) and pretreated with \(0.1 \%\) DMSO, pan caspase inhibitor (Z-IVAD-FMK), caspase-8 inhibitor (Z-IEDT-FMK) or caspase inhibitor (Z-IVAD-FMK). The CD87 gene was found in combination with 0.1\% DMSO or flavopiridol for an additional \(24 \mathrm{hr}\). The viability of cells was measured by CellTier-Glase (100-100) and CD87 (100-100) and CD87 (100-110) and CD87 (100-110) and CD87 and CD87 (100-110) and CD87 (110-110) and CD87 (110-110) (110-110) and CD87 (110-120) and discharges for \(24 \mathrm{hr}\). The caspase inhibitors were used as described above. Whole cell lysates were prepared and subjected to Western blot analysis using anti-PARP and caspase-3 antibodies. The data represent the means of three separate experiments performed in triplicate: bars represent \(\mathrm{SD}, \Psi, p<.009, \gamma\), treatment, \(\gamma\), to treatment.

Figure 4 - The apoptotic effects of flavopiridol via mitochondrial pathway in the ADR clones of OS and EFTs. (a) After the treatment of parental (P) or ADR cells of MNG and WE-68 (5 \(\times 10^{4}\) cells) with flavopiridol for \(24 \mathrm{hr}\), the cytosolic extracts were obtained and subjected to Western blot analysis as described in Material and methods (B) and EFTs. (b) The CD87 gene was found in CD87 and CD87 (100/100/100/100/100) and CD87 (100/110/100/100/100) and CD87 (24hr, EFTs were treated with various concentrations of flavopiridol for \(24 \mathrm{hr}\), The whole cell lysates were prepared and Western blot analysis was carried out using anti-p53, Ba, Bcl-L, Bcl-2, and actin antibodies.
FMK efficiently inhibited flavopiridol-induced caspase-3 activation and cleavage of PARP in MNG/ADR cells. These results revealed that flavopiridol could induce caspase-dependent apoptosis in the drug-resistant OS and EFTs clones, and that caspase-3 inhibitor, but not caspase-8 inhibitor, could prevent the cleavage of caspase-3 and the activation of PARP.
The apoptotic effect of flavopiridol was mainly mediated by mitochondrial pathway in the ADR clones of OS and EFTs. The CD87 gene was found in CD87 and CD87 (101/100/100/100/100/10) and CD87 (101/100/100/10) and CD87 (
